title: How to Personalize Your Windows Terminal Experience with Oh My Posh
text: Customize your Windows Terminal with Oh My Posh theme for PowerShell, WSL/Ubuntu and more!

title: Getting started with Virtual Machines: A Guide to Understanding Virtualization Technology
text: A virtual machine (VM) is a computer program that creates a virtual environment that allows users to run programs and access files as if they were running on a physical machine.

title: Docker Basic: Dockerizing Angular App Locally
text: A key takeaway in this piece is at the end you'll know how to dockerize the angular application and publish it in the Docker Hub.

title: Organize your spaghetti code using Separation of Concern Design Principle
text: The separation of concern (SoC) is a software design principle that delivers the modularity of a program and encapsulates the necessary information.

title: Terse, Expressive, Does one thing: Your code should do TED talk using TED Principle
text: The TED Rule's main concept is naming of code should be easy to understand by everyone. When writing code, consider that your audience isn't just a computer but also a human.

title: Don't Repeat Yourself Principle: Forge your code DRY as the Sahara Desert
text: The DRY principle states that every piece of knowledge must have a single, unambiguous representation within a system.

title: Scrutinize the Pragmatic Programmer's 3 Key Attributes
text: Do you wonder how to be a good programmer? Did you know every legend in programming has key attributes that make them stand out?

title: 7 Lessons in the Software Developer's Life Manual by John Sonmez
text: As software developers, we should have good soft skills, not just technical skills. It will help us make progress in our career.
